page.title: 08MUSEUMS IN SHEFFIELD
page.content: {Sheffield City Museum,}at Weston Park, opened in 1937. It houses the world's finest collection of{'Old Sheffield {Plate',}silver and ceramics. Also on display are the Bateman Collection of antiquities from Yorkshire and the Peak District, Bronze Age finds and a unique Anglo-Saxon helmet,the story of the earth, birds and mammals and famous Sheffield cutlery. A series of changing exhibitions is located in the entrance-hall. The{Extension Services}organises group visits for all age ranges and local schools can borrow specimens. Several societies meet there; archaeology, natural history, numismatics etc. Meteorological readings have been taken here since 1883. The{Mappin Art Gallery}is adjacent.
